On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.     Lessons are held in person for elementary schools, middle schools, special schools, and polytechnic schools.   Final classes are taught face-to-face for the upper secondary level.    A staggering of the daily start of school and the use of alternative rooms is recommended if possible.  Schoolwork can take place again with sufficient preparation time. The amount of schoolwork per semester is restricted.  Strict hygiene regulations apply - in general, but especially for objects such as music, exercise and sport or practical teaching.    “Universities and colleges remain excluded from the direct scope of the COVID-19 measures regulations in the health sector. Since the beginning of the COVID-19 crisis, they have proven that they act responsibly and trustingly within the framework of their autonomy.”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219043206/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/schule/beratung/corona/schulbetrieb_20201207.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219043735/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/HS-Uni/Aktuelles/corona/hochschulbetrieb.html

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    Restaurants will remain closed. It is still possible to pick up food and drinks between 6 a.m. and 7 p.m. The food and drinks must not be consumed within 50 meters of the business premises. Delivery service is possible around the clock.    Accommodation establishments may only be used in exceptional cases, in particular for professional purposes or to satisfy an urgent need for housing.    Shops are allowed to stay open until 7 p.m. at the latest, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations. All services, including those close to the body (hairdressers, masseurs, etc.), may be offered. The distance rule of at least one meter, the 10 m2 rule per customer and the mandatory wearing of mouth and nose protection while shopping / using a service apply.    If the distance rule cannot be adhered to while using a service due to its nature, the consumption of food and drinks is prohibited during this time.    In shopping centers there is a no-stay in the general areas. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted there.    Wherever possible, employees should switch to a home office. Mouth and nose protection must be worn at the workplace if the minimum distance is less than one meter. Other suitable protective measures are also possible (permanent teams, partition walls).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    Theatres, cinemas, cultural events, and sporting events are still prohibited. This does not apply to rehearsals and artistic performances without an audience that are carried out for professional purposes, as well as professional sports.     Christmas markets are cancelled.     Demonstrations are allowed.    The minimum distance and mouth-nose protection obligations must be observed at all events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219061909/https://www.austria.info/en/service-and-facts/coronavirus-information

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    Birthday parties and wedding celebrations are still prohibited.     Professional meetings that cannot be postponed and meetings for absolutely necessary professional training and further education purposes are possible.     Funerals can take place with a maximum of 50 people.     The minimum distance and mouth-nose protection obligations must be observed at all events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    In mass transportation and the associated underground stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports, people who do not live in the same household must be kept at least one meter away from people and wear mouth and nose protection. If it is not possible to maintain a distance of at least one meter due to the number of passengers and when boarding and alighting, this can be excepted.                                                  In motor vehicles (private car, taxi, Uber) a maximum of two people per row of seats may be carried (exception: shared household). Mouth and nose protection must also be worn.    Cable cars, gondolas and ascent aids may not be used for leisure purposes.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    Partial curfew remains in place from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m.    Leaving the private living area and staying outside the private living area are only permitted between 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. for the following purposes:  – Averting immediate danger to life, limb and property  – Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties  – Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  – Contact with the partner who does not live in the same household or contact with individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) or individual important reference persons, with whom physical or non-physical contact is usually maintained several times a week - only one other person from another household may meet people from the same household  – The supply of basic goods of daily life  – The use of health services or testing for COVID-19 as part of screening programs  – The coverage of a need for housing  – The satisfaction of basic religious needs, such as visits to cemeteries and individual visits to places of worship  – The care of animals  – Professional and training purposes, if necessary  – Staying outdoors for physical and psychological recovery (e.g. going for a walk, jogging, walking the dog) alone or with people with whom contact is still permitted (life partner, own household, individual close relatives, individual important caregivers, as described above)  – To pursue administrative or judicial proceedings that cannot be postponed  – To participate in statutory elections and to use statutory instruments of direct democracy  – For the purpose of entering locations and customer areas of business premises that are permitted under this ordinance  – To participate in the permitted events listed in the ordinance    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

On 7 December, the lockdown initiated on 17 November ended.    Internal movement is limited to between 6 a.m. and 8 p.m. due to the partial curfew.   Exceptions are noted in C6.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219061552/https://at.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

As of 19 December, entry is prohibited to third-country nationals when arriving from any states except those listed as safe countries.    For Austrian citizens and residents of Austria, EU, UK, Switzerland, and safe countries, a 10-day self-quarantine is mandatory when arriving from a risk area.     After 5 days of quarantine at the earliest, an antigen or PCR test can be taken. If the test is negative, no further quarantine is needed.     Safe countries: Australia, Finland, Ireland, Iceland, Japan, New Zealand, Norway, South Korea, Uruguay, and the Vatican.   All other countries are considered risk areas.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219062547/https://www.austria.info/en/service-and-facts/coronavirus-information/entry-regulations

As of 19 December, short-time work is still available.      Short-time work supports companies in order to keep as many employees as possible in the company, even in times of financial crisis. The employment service (AMS) takes over the majority of the salary payments.     Short-time working cannot be requested by individual employees; this decision can only be made by the company itself. In general, support can only be given to companies that have been severely affected by the current corona crisis and have thus got into a critical financial situation.    80-90% of the salary will be covered during short-time work.    The Corona short-time work is currently limited to a duration of 3 months. This time frame can later be extended by a further 3 months.    In principle, all employees subject to unemployment insurance are eligible for short-time work, provided they have a fully paid calendar month before starting short-time work.    Members of the executive body are eligible if they are ASVG-insured; also board members who are subject to the ASVG.    Apprentices are eligible.    Freelance workers are eligible if normal working hours can be shown.    Marginally employed persons, civil servants, one-person entrepreneurs and shareholders-managing directors subject to GSVG are not covered by the short-time working regulations.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220015045/https://www.bmafj.gv.at/Kurzarbeit-Infoseite.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220015310/https://www.bmafj.gv.at/Services/News/Coronavirus/FAQ--Kurzarbeit.html

No policy change    As of 19 December, loan deferral is still possible for borrowers who can no longer meet their payment obligations from consumer loans.     The statutory measures provide for a statutory right to defer payments that are to be made in the period from April 1, 2020 to January 31, 2021 on the basis of a consumer credit agreement. This means that if necessary, flat-rate installments (installments including principal and interest payments), capital repayments or interest payments can be suspended (deferred) for 10 months in full.    The deferral means that the payments owed in the deferral period will be postponed to future dates. The law provides that the deferred 10 months are added to the agreed term of the loan agreement - the term of the loan is extended by 10 months. However, instead of extending the term, borrowers can also agree with the bank that the deferred installments will be made up later.     Since the right to deferment was laid down in law, banks are not allowed to charge any charges (processing fee) for the deferral.    The law also stipulates that the bank may not terminate a consumer loan - i.e. loans, overdrafts and foreign currency loans - in the period from 01/04/2020 to 01/31/2021. This means that for loans, a maturity due to missing installments, which would have been paid between 01/04/2020 and 01/31/2021, is not possible. In the case of account overdrafts, the law means that a bank can make the overdraft due for repayment on February 1, 2021 at the earliest.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201220023025/https://www.arbeiterkammer.at/beratung/konsument/Geld/Kredite/Geldsorgen_mit_Kredit_durch_Corona.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220023331/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

No policy change     As of 19 December, detailed, multilingual information is still available on the Social Ministry's website (https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus).     The website includes current coronavirus information, current measures, vaccination information, frequently asked questions, coronavirus hotlines, legal information, and the corona traffic light.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201220035621/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus

Population-wide testing was carried out between 4 December and 15 December, depending upon the region. The tests were free and optional.     All citizens of school age and older who live in Austria were able to participate. People who were in Austria for work or study reasons were also allowed to participate. Minors needed to be accompanied by a legal guardian.    Persons not tested included those who had symptoms that indicated COVID-19 disease, were on sick leave due to another illness, were in official segregation in the last three months because of a SARS-CoV-2 positive test, were in quarantine, isolation or domestic isolation, have already been reserved a test for another official appointment, are regularly tested for professional reasons, and children before compulsory schooling.    As of 14 December, 22% of the population had participated – far short of the 60% the government initially said it was aiming for.     "It's a successful step to contain the pandemic in Austria," Health Minister Rudolf Anschober told a press conference, adding that two million people across the country had participated in the voluntary tests out of a population of 8.8 million.  "In the future, we want to reach groups that have not yet responded positively to the tests. We are reviewing a large number of possible courses of action.”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220043053/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Haeufig-gestellte-Fragen/FAQ--Testungen-und-Quarantaene.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220040926/https://www.thelocal.at/20201214/austria-defends-unpopular-mass-testing-scheme

No policy change    As of 19 December, contact tracing is still in place.     Contact persons are defined as persons with defined contact to a confirmed case during the time period of infectivity (48 hours before the onset of the disease, up to 10 days after the onset of the disease).    Contact tracers notify persons which shared the same environment as the confirmed case. Depending on how long and intensive the contact was with this person, one is identified as contact person K1 or K2. Further instructions are then given depending upon this classification.    “Stop Corona” app is Austria’s official contact tracing app which automatically records any and all contacts while adhering to strict data protection guidelines. As soon as a user reports an infection, all contacts are automatically notified. Use of the app is optional.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201220043053/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Haeufig-gestellte-Fragen/FAQ--Testungen-und-Quarantaene.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220044213/https://www.austria.info/en/service-and-facts/coronavirus-information/app

No policy change    As of 19 December, mouth and nose protection must be worn in the following areas:  – All closed rooms that are open to the public  – Public transport, planes, taxis and taxi-like operations (including stops, stations, and departure halls)  – Connecting structures in shopping centers    In public places, all persons who do not live in their own household must keep one meter away. When meeting in closed public spaces, a distance of one meter must be kept and mouth and nose protection must be worn.    It is not compulsory to wear mouth and nose protection outdoors, with the exception of the events listed in Section 12 of the ordinance (e.g. demonstrations, funerals). Regarding this, there may be regional rules of their own.    In the workplace, mouth and nose protection must be worn in closed rooms if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures (e.g. by means of a technical protective device such as partition or plexiglass walls).     If technical protective measures make it impossible to carry out the work (e.g. for actors), organizational protective measures (such as the formation of permanent teams) must be provided instead.    Employees and employers can mutually agree on stricter regulations regarding the wearing of mouth and nose protection.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219044559/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

As of 19 December, there is no COVID-19 vaccine available in Austria.    There will be free vaccines for all people in Austria who want to be vaccinated. The republic will buy the vaccines centrally and distribute them to many places, which will then carry out the vaccinations.    The federal government and other government representatives have repeatedly emphasized that there will be no general compulsory vaccination.    The first effective, safe and effective vaccines in relevant quantities could be available in Austria from the beginning of 2021. The crucial point is the central European approval for the European Union. Only then will the vaccines meet the statutory quality requirements.    Because not enough vaccines will be initially available to vaccinate everyone at the same time, the people who are at the highest risk will be vaccinated at the beginning. After that all others can be vaccinated step by step.     “We are confident that by the 2nd quarter there will be enough vaccines available to vaccinate anyone who wishes to be vaccinated.”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220054442/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Haeufig-gestellte-Fragen/FAQ--COVID-19-Impfung.html

On December 8, 2020, the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Azerbaijan announced that the special quarantine regime to stop the spread of COVID-19 will remain in effect through January 31, 2021.  Due to the high level of infection in Azerbaijan in recent months, a strict special quarantine regime will be in effect throughout the country from 00:00 on December 14, 2020 to 00:00 on January 18, 2021. All commercial establishments, public catering establishments, including restaurants, cafes and tea houses, are only allowed to provide delivery services to customers or sell them online. Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

Up to 14 December, strict quarantine measures are implemented in 2 cities and 8 districts. It requires that all non-essential businesses remain closed, and all non-essential activities banned. Exceptions are limited to the activities of grocery stores, pharmacies, security forces, healthcare providers, utility service providers, freight services, and financial services. Access to these cities will be controlled; police checkpoints have been erected on approaches to these areas.     See security agency Garda website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201219064924/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/410121/azerbaijan-authorities-extend-strict-covid-19-related-quarantine-regime-measures-in-several-areas-until-dec-14-update-24

Exceptions are limited to the activities of grocery stores, pharmacies, security forces, healthcare providers, utility service providers, freight services, and financial services. Access to these cities will be controlled; police checkpoints have been erected on approaches to these areas.     See government Ministerial Cabinet decision: https://koronavirusinfo.az/files/3/78933e9d16f649ed659861358360f732.pdf

From December 14 until January 18 - the coding for C6 has to be 3T.  Between December 14 and January 18, an SMS-permission system to leave one’s place of residence will be in effect in the cities of Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Mingachevir, and Shirvan, as well as the Absheron region and the Lankaran, Masalli, Jalilabad, Sheki, Zagatala, Guba, Khachmaz, Yevlakh, Barda, Bilasuvar and Ismayilli district centers (except villages and settlements).  You should carry your personal I.D. with you at all times when outside in case you are stopped by the authorities. SMS-permission can be issued once a day for 3 hours, and is required to leave one’s residence to purchase food and other daily necessities and medicines (from grocery stores, supermarkets, markets and pharmacies), to use public services, banking, postal and other services, as well as for urgent medical necessity or scheduled treatment.  For such medical needs, the permit is issued within 3 hours, taking into account the distance between the district and the destination address, the duration of the treatment procedure, and the period of return, determined by a certificate issued by a doctor.  You can use a relative or friend’s phone to obtain this permission using your own State Migration Service registration number. Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

Curfew remains in effect from 9:00 pm to 6:00 am (21:00 to 06:00) every day in Baku, Ganja, Sumgayit, Yevlakh, Mingachevir, Naftalan, Absheron, Jabrayil, Fuzuli, Agjabadi, Beylagan, Agdam, Barda, Tartar, Goranboy, Goygol, Dashkasan, Gadabay, Tovuz, Shamkir, Gazakh and Agstafa districts. Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

Land traffic in and out of Azerbaijan remains closed.  Special, private, and charter flights continue to operate. Azerbaijan Airlines (AZAL) and Turkish Airlines are offering multiple weekly flights between Baku and Turkey.  Ukraine International Airlines will run a charter flight December 14, 21, and 28 from Baku to Kyiv for Ukrainian citizens and travelers with a Ukrainian residence permit.  Limited flights to Moscow and Doha may also be available.  Flight reservations should be made directly through the airlines.    Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

With Limited Exceptions, Only Azerbaijani Citizens Allowed on Flights into Azerbaijan  AZAL announced that in addition to Azerbaijani citizens, the following individuals will be permitted to fly to Azerbaijan: •  Heads and staff of foreign embassies and consulates accredited in the Republic of Azerbaijan and their family members; •  Foreign citizens, one of whose parents, spouse or child is a citizen of the Republic of Azerbaijan; •  Foreign citizens who have a work permit in Azerbaijan; •  Foreign citizens with a temporary or permanent residence permit in Azerbaijan; •  Foreign students studying in one of Azerbaijan’s higher education institutions. Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

The government of Azerbaijan stated that about 600 business representatives will receive a one-time payment of about 190 AZN as a result of the extension of quarantine measures until January 31. It should be noted that 190 AZN is less than 50% of the median salary in Azerbaijan whereas the government said that only business representatives will receive a payment which is more about formal workers.   https://archive.vn/dxEaB

Taking into account the financial impact of the strict quarantine measures implemented in specific cities and regions from 14 December 2020 to 18 January 2021, a one-time financial assistance of 190 manat (average monthly income is 700 manat) is paid to 600,000 people in financial need. Additionally, financial assistance will be provided to entrepreneurs operating in the affected areas. Testing for asymptomatic was temporarily banned due to laboratory workload in Azerbaijan.   Link: https://archive.vn/CfuoW https://archive.vn/oE7MP

Testing is based on the WHO case definition and includes either a patient with acute respiratory illness (fever and at least one sign/symptom of respiratory disease (e.g., cough, shortness of breath), AND with no other etiology that fully explains the clinical presentation AND a history of travel to or residence in a country/area or territory reporting local transmission of COVID-19 during the 14 days prior to symptom onset, or a patient with any acute respiratory illness AND having been in contact with a confirmed or probable COVID-19 case in the last 14 days prior to onset of symptoms; or a patient with severe acute respiratory infection (fever and at least one sign/symptom of respiratory disease (e.g., cough, shortness breath) AND requiring hospitalization AND with no other etiology that fully explains the clinical presentation. See WHO website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201219093015/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/azerbaijan/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5+Testing&Type=Chapter#6Testing
No changes found since the last announcements

On December 1, the police reported about 26 infected people with COVID-19 who violated the self-isolation rule. Violators were from different regions and cities. The only measure taken by police regarding those violators is establishing administrative fines - no contact tracing measures were reported. Moreover, there is no latest news on contact tracing measures. It can be argued that the contact tracing in Azerbaijan is limited. Link: https://archive.vn/4uiy6

Active contact tracing is implemented in all cases immediately upon identification of a case. See WHO website, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201219093015/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/azerbaijan/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5+Testing&Type=Chapter#6Testing
No changes found since the last announcements

Masks are mandatory in all public spaces. Non-compliance with the rules regarding social distancing, movement restrictions, mask mandates, and gathering in large groups can result in fines up to 200 AZN.  Link: https://archive.vn/w0iU5

From December 14 until January 18 - the coding for H6 has to be 4G.  On December 8, 2020, the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Azerbaijan announced that the special quarantine regime to stop the spread of COVID-19 will remain in effect through January 31, 2021. Due to the high level of infection in Azerbaijan in recent months, a strict special quarantine regime will be in effect throughout the country from 00:00 on December 14, 2020, to 00:00 on January 18, 2021. The use of medical masks is mandatory in all indoor and outdoor areas of the country during the special quarantine regime. Link: https://archive.vn/lbsSC

From 14 December 2020 and 18 January 2021, in specific areas with strict quarantine measures, the use of medical masks is mandatory in all indoor and outdoor areas. See Cabinet of Ministers website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201219085900/https://nk.gov.az/az/article/1263/

Belgium extends financial aid to businesses affected by coronavirus measures. The Council of Ministers approved a royal decree extending to January the doubling of financial allowance for independents affected by Covid-19 measures.  In December, it covers independents in the hospitality, events, entertainment, culture, fairs, markets, travel, hairdressing and beauty sectors. The double “droit de passerelle” (transitional allowance) as the mechanism is called, grants independents without family responsibilities 2,583.40 euros per month in Covid-19 support, while those with families are eligible for 3,228.20 euros. The mechanism, which initially covered October and November, was first extended to December, and now covers the month of January, pending the implementation of a new system next year.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201215140729/https://www.brusselstimes.com/news/belgium-all-news/145101/belgium-doubles-financial-allowance-for-independents-affected-by-covid-19-measures/

According to the Order RD-01-677/25.11.2020, Minister of Education and Science decided the transition to distance learning in electronic environment.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/5NRBG

No policy change    As of 7 December, order RD-01-677 remains in effect.     Attended classes (including internships, outsourced classes, exams, dual system of training, etc.) in schools and personal development support centers are suspended.    The decision for transitioning to distance learning in an electronic environment was made by the Minister of Education and Science under the conditions and by the order of art. 105, para. 6 and 115a, para. 1, 4 and 5 of the Preschool and School Education Act.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207051648/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

According to the Order RD-01-677/25.11.2020, employers should allow the presence of maximum of 50% of the staff, where it is possible. Also, visits to gambling halls, casinos, and shopping centers (representing one or more buildings in which shops, restaurants and other commercial sites are located), trips of tourists are suspended.   Link: https://archive.fo/wip/5NRBG

No policy change    As of 7 December, order RD-01-677 remains in effect.     Visits to shopping centers (representing one or more buildings in which shops, restaurants and other commercial sites are located) are suspended. Visits to casinos, gambling halls, and fitness halls are also suspended. Exceptions include grocery stores, hospitals, pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, pet stores, banks, insurers, payment service providers, and telecommunications offices.    If possible, employees are to work remotely. A maximum of 50% of staff are allowed to work in-person. Employers are to establish working hours with variable limits or shifts. Employers are to approve a schedule for the use of regulated holidays, as well as to apply other preventive measures and methods of work, which will provide a better level of protection of workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207051648/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

Employers are to approve a schedule for the use of regulated holidays, as well as to apply other preventive measures and methods of work, which will provide a better level of protection of workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214074705/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

Also, visits to gambling halls, casinos, and shopping centers, trips of tourists are suspended.   Link: https://archive.fo/wip/5NRBG

According to the Order ? RD-01-547/30.09.202 of the Minister of Health, starting with 1st of October, was introduces a temporary ban on entering the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria. This ban is not applied to Bulgarian nationals, nationals of Member States of the European Union, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Schengen Parties (including the Republic of San Marino, the Principality of Andorra, the Principality of Monaco and the Vatican City State) and their family members including persons who are in actual cohabitation with them); citizens of the Union of Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, New Zealand, the Republic of Rwanda, the Republic of Korea, the Kingdom of Thailand, the Republic of Tunisia, the Oriental Republic of Uruguay, the United Arab Emirates, Ukraine, the Republic of Northern Macedonia, the Republic of Serbia and the Republic of Albania Herzegovina, Montenegro, the Republic of Moldova, Israel, the State of Kuwait, the Republic of Belarus and the Republic of Turkey; persons with permanent status, long-term or long-term residence on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria and the members of their families; persons holding a Bulgarian long-stay visa type.  Link: https://archive.fo/5NRBG and https://web.archive.org/web/20201021201735/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/538

No policy change    As of 7 December, order RD-01-547 remains in effect.    A temporary ban on entry into the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria of all persons has been introduced, regardless of their nationality, at all border crossing points, by air, sea, rail and road.     The ban does not apply to Bulgarian citizens, citizens of Member States of the European Union (EU), the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Schengen countries (including the Republic of San Marino, the Principality of Andorra, the Principality of Monaco and the Vatican City State) and their family members (including those who are actually living with them); citizens of the Union of Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, New Zealand, the Republic of Rwanda, the Republic of Korea, the Kingdom of Thailand, the Republic of Tunisia, the Oriental Republic of Uruguay, the United Arab Emirates, Ukraine, the Republic of Northern Macedonia, the Republic of Serbia and the Republic of Albania Herzegovina, Montenegro, the Republic of Moldova, Israel, The State of Kuwait, the Republic of Belarus and the Republic of Turkey; the persons with the status of permanent, long-term or long-term residence on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria and the members of their families; persons holding a Bulgarian long-stay visa type "D".    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207051648/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

Nearly 30,000 Bulgarian farmers receive Covid-19 compensations, announced the Prime Minister of Bulgaria, Boyko Borissov, on 14th of October.  Link: https://archive.fo/Rktoj

From 30 November, employers whose activities have been suspended due to the anti-epidemic measures imposed can apply to the employment offices under the Save Me project.     Employees are entitled to receive BGN 24 per day for the period in which they were on unpaid leave. For employees of 4 hours the compensation is BGN 12 per day. Compensation will be paid for a maximum of 60 days.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207052109/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/socialni

No policy change     As of 9 December, over BGN 585 million has been transferred so far to the companies and enterprises that have applied under the measure 60/40 for maintaining the employment of their employees.     The jobs saved are about 250,000, and all workers receive their full wages and insurances. The state compensations amount to 60% of the due salaries and insurances, and the employers are obliged to insure the remaining 40%.     Employers whose activities have been suspended due to the anti-epidemic measures imposed can apply to the employment offices under the Save Me project. Their employees are entitled to receive BGN 24 per day for the period in which they were on unpaid leave. For employees of 4 hours the compensation is BGN 12 per day. Compensation will be paid for a maximum of 60 days.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214080028/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/960    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214080219/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/socialni

Rather general statement on support as of December 17, 2020, such as allocation of BGN 1,024 million to the state-owned company "The Fund of Funds" to provide subsidies to micro enterprises, self-employed, entrepreneurs from vulnerable groups, and eligible SMEs and companies, and allocation of BGN 418 million to the Urban Development Funds, managed by the Fund of Funds, for long-term investment and working capital, targeting municipalities, PPPs and businesses, hit by the crisis, including tourism and transport; source: /web/20201221134035/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

No policy change    A moratorium of up to six months on bank loan payments was introduced in April in Bulgaria, with applications set to close in June. That was later extended to September.     As of 7 December, “The Association of Banks in Bulgaria is working on changes of the rules on the delay of loan repayments. The changes will be presented to the central bank soon and announced appropriately, if approved”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207052252/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-bulgaria-banks/bulgarian-banks-consider-extension-of-loan-repayment-delay-idUKL1N2II1VI    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207052344/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

On 11 December, the Governing Council of the Bulgarian National Bank approved the extension of the "Procedure for deferral and settlement of due liabilities to banks and their subsidiaries - financial institutions".      This is the second extension of this policy. Originally introduced in April, it allowed for people and companies to stop servicing their bank loans for up to six months.    Borrowers will now be able to negotiate with lenders until 31 March 2021 to delay payments of both interest and the principal for nine months. Those who have already had six months of loan repayment holidays can negotiate three additional months.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214230757/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/972    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214230618/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-bulgaria-banks/bulgarian-banks-extend-loan-repayment-moratorium-idUSL1N2IR173    https://web.archive.org/web/20201213231506/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

As of December 17, 2020, capitalization of the 2019 profit in the banking system, increase in liquidity of the banking system by BGN 7 billion, agreement on a moratorium on bank loan payments for up to 6 months, and establishment of EUR 2 billion swap line with the ECB until end-2020 or as long as necessary among others; source: /web/20201221134035/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
Information materials of the Ministry of Health and the World Health Organization were published.   Links: https://archive.fo/qhpTL and https://archive.fo/3zrVn

No policy change      As of 7 December, the unified information portal remains the official source of information on measures to combat the spread of COVID-19 in Bulgaria (https://coronavirus.bg). The portal provides statistics, news briefings, video materials, and information about COVID-19 in Bulgaria.     An official chatbot of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Bulgaria is available, which provides real-time official information and news about COVID-19 through Viber.     The ViruSafe mobile app is available, which gives users the ability to track their symptoms and health status daily. This information gives the Ministry of Health a good overview of the spread of the pandemic. Users can also voluntarily share their location to enable institutions to act accordingly, in case of an emergency.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207053136/https://virusafe.info/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207053225/https://coronavirus.bg/

Testing procedures depend on whether you are a first- or second-line contact person, suffer from a chronic illness, fall into the risk category of people over 60, be a medical professional, and have symptoms.   Link: https://archive.fo/wip/lRzIP

No policy change    As of 7 December, testing procedures depend on whether you are a first- or second-line contact person, suffer from a chronic illness, fall into the risk category of people over 60, be a medical professional and have symptoms.     Testing for coronavirus is performed at the discretion of the regional health inspectorate, the medical institution where the patient is hospitalized or the relevant medical person in the designated places for examination and diagnosis (based on symptoms) or with a referral (can be issued electronically or on paper) by a general practitioner.    A referral for a PCR test will also be issued to individuals who test positive for a rapid antigen test performed by an authorized medical care provider.    Optional testing can be done in a private laboratory.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207053310/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/936    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207053358/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/az-sum/litse-simptomi

No policy change    As of 14 December, testing procedures depend on whether the individual is a first- or second-line contact person, suffers from a chronic illness, falls into the risk category of people over 60, is a medical professional, and has symptoms.     Testing for coronavirus is performed at the discretion of the regional health inspectorate, the medical institution where the patient is hospitalized or the relevant medical person in the designated places for examination and diagnosis (based on symptoms) or with a referral (can be issued electronically or on paper) by a general practitioner.    A referral for a PCR test will also be issued to individuals who test positive for a rapid antigen test performed by an authorized medical care provider.    Optional testing can be done in a private laboratory.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214232532/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/936    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214083718/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/az-sum/litse-simptomi

People having symptoms and meet specific criteria (e.g. key workers, admitted to hospital, contact with known case, returned from oversees); source:  /web/20201221124307/https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/covid-19-testing-policy?stackMode=absolute&time=2020-12-20&country=®ion=World

According to the Order ? RD-01-547/30.09.202 of the Minister of Health, all close contacts of a confirmed case of COVID-19 are subject to a 10-day quarantine, as of their last contact with the infected person. Also, the monitoring of the health condition of each contact person is performed by the general practitioner or the respective regional health inspection.  Link: https://archive.fo/keCbe and https://archive.fo/wip/lRzIP

No policy change    As of 7 December, order RD-01-675 remains in effect.     When serving customers directly, requiring a distance of less than 1.5 meters, the use of a face mask or safety helmet is mandatory.     Customer service without a face mask or safety helmet is allowed when mechanical partitions made of glass or other transparent material are provided, allowing wet cleaning or disinfection.    All persons when in closed public places, including means of public transport, medical and health establishments, pharmacies, opticians, national centers for public health, administrative institutions and other places where they are served or citizens have access to railway and bus stations, airports, metro stations, shops, churches, monasteries, temples, museums, etc., must have a protective face mask for single or multiple use or other means covering the nose and mouth (including a towel, scarf, helmet, etc.).    All persons, when they are in open public places, where there is a crowd of people and impossibility to observe a physical distance of 1.5 m, are obliged to have a protective face mask for single or multiple use or other means of covering nose and mouth (including towel, scarf, helmet, etc.), which are used according to the recommendations in the order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207051648/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

On 4 December, the National Plan for Vaccination against COVID-19 was adopted. No deliveries yet received so coded as 0    The vaccine for Bulgarian citizens will be completely free and voluntary, according to the Prime Minister.     There are two conditions for immunization - expressed desire and informed consent.    "We are fulfilling our commitment and adopting the National Plan on time. The country is ready and logistically to meet the first delivery of vaccines and, without wasting any time, to start immunization, which will be completely free and voluntary," said Borissov.    The Minister of Health reports that the necessary freezers for storing the vaccines are already available, as well as specialized transport for their delivery in the country. Angelov emphasized that the vaccination plan specifies the phases that determine which groups of the population and in what order will be immunized against the new virus - medical teams, social and pedagogical staff, the elderly over 65 years, patients with chronic diseases."    Parliament has backed the government plan to take part in an EU scheme and get vaccine shots from Pfizer, AstraZeneca and Sanofi.    Vaccines will be administered only with the permission of the European regulator. To ensure that sufficient quantities of COVID-19 vaccines are provided in the country as soon as possible, they will be delivered centrally through a joint EU public procurement mechanism.    The government expects to receive 12-13 million doses at a total cost of about EUR 250 million (USD 304 million).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214235545/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/938    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214235756/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/news/939    https://web.archive.org/web/20201215015622if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-bulgaria-vaccines/bulgaria-prepares-for-covid-19-vaccines-as-death-rates-spike-idUSKBN28E0Z3

Internal movement remains allowed. However:  The departure of citizens of the Republic of Belarus and foreigners permanently residing in the country through functioning ground checkpoints is temporarily suspended (with no ending date announced), with the exception of certain cases. Aviation checkpoints, however, will not be affected by this restriction.  Restrictions on entry for foreigners through ground checkpoints remain in effect. In addition, incoming foreigners over six years old will need medical documents confirming a negative PCR test for COVID-19.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201228093903/https://gpk.gov.by/news/gpk/78840/

The land border crossings and railroad border crossings for regular border traffic for entry into Belarus for third-country nationals remain closed. This concerns entry by land from the countries Lithuania, Latvia, Poland and Ukraine. Entry via airports is possible, including 10-day isolation, etc. as mentioned in earlier coding entries.

No new income support announced. Also, Prime Minister Roman Golovchenko said that the government did not see a slowdown in economic activity in Belarus amidst the second wave of COVID-19 and the social commitments of the state were not only fulfilled, but also over-fulfilled as the average salary reached Br1,300.     “The 8.9% increase in real household income is another testimony to the efficient economic performance,”    “Despite the difficult situation our economy is performing quite well, much better than the economies of many of our neighbors, including the economically stronger ones. According to preliminary estimates, our gross domestic product this year will be at least as big as 99% of last year's. This is the main economic outcome. It is very encouraging that the manufacturing industry has bounced back in recent months,”    “Even when the whole world is struggling through the coronavirus second wave, we do not see a slowdown in economic activity in our country so far,”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201228095057/https://eng.belta.by/economics/view/pm-no-economic-slowdown-in-belarus-amidst-coronavirus-second-wave-136198-2020/    Considering the official stand of the Belarus' government regarding Covid-19, new financial/economic/fiscal measures seem unlikely within the upcoming months at least.

Noting that on 16 October 2020 Health Minister Constantinos Ioannou said Cyprus’ track and trace unit is swamped after a dramatic spike in the number of coronavirus cases and cannot therefore communicate with all the contacts of positive Covid-19 cases in the optimal time frame. In response, on 23 October 2020 the health ministry modified the process of informing those who tested positive to coronavirus, and their contacts, due to the large amount of daily coronavirus cases. People who test positive will now receive a text message if the unit fails to inform them via phone the same day their results are out.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202182827/https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/10/16/coronavirus-contact-tracing-unit-swamped-after-surge-in-cases/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202183105/https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/10/23/coronavirus-text-messages-part-of-new-directions-for-contact-tracing/

Schools and kindergartens remain open. In regions with an indictment of more than 50 new infections per 100,000 inhabitants, on the school premises of all schools where the distance is not observed / in lessons in secondary schools from grade 7, all persons are required to wear a mouth and nose cover.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

No changes for the last week. New changes are being proposed for the upcoming weeks    Links -   http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162625/https://www.deutschland.de/en/news/coronavirus-in-germany-informations  http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162943/https://de.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Details:  - Germany is imposing a hard lockdown from Wednesday.Trade, with the exception of shops for daily needs, will be closed from 16 December to 10 January  - For the days from 24 to 26 December, "meetings with 5 persons plus children up to 14 years of age in the closest family circle" are permitted.   - For New Year's Eve and New Year's Day (1 January), there is a nationwide ban on the presence and assembly of fireworks.  - German government wants to provide more than 27 million German citizens with mouth-nose masks. People over 60 or with pre-existing conditions are to receive 15 FFP2 masks each from mid-December. The distribution will start in December in order to reduce the risk of infection during the Christmas season

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    Contacts in schools, too, are to be drastically reduced between 16 December 2020 and 10 January  2021. During this period, children should be kept at home wherever possible. For this reason, all  schools will be closed or waive the obligation to attend during this period. Emergency childcare  services will be provided and remote learning offered. Special arrangements can be made for final  year classes. Nurseries will proceed similarly. Additional options will be created for parents to take  paid leave to look after their children during this period    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

Wholesalers and retailers will also remain open in compliance with hygiene rules and a reduced number of customers. However, the following applies: The number of customers in the shops is limited. With a sales area of up to 800 square meters, there may only be one person per 10 square meters of sales area in the store. There are also corresponding restrictions for larger institutions. Leisure facilities in the form of cinemas, restaurants, museums, amusement arcades, brothels, swimming pools and other leisure facilities will be closed for the time being. Fitness studios, swimming pools and fun pools will also be closed. Hotels and guest houses are no longer allowed to accept tourists.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

No changes for the last week. New changes are being proposed for the upcoming weeks    Links -   http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162625/https://www.deutschland.de/en/news/coronavirus-in-germany-informations  http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162943/https://de.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Details:  - Germany is imposing a hard lockdown from Wednesday.Trade, with the exception of shops for daily needs, will be closed from 16 December to 10 January  - For the days from 24 to 26 December, "meetings with 5 persons plus children up to 14 years of age in the closest family circle" are permitted.   - For New Year's Eve and New Year's Day (1 January), there is a nationwide ban on the presence and assembly of fireworks.  - German government wants to provide more than 27 million German citizens with mouth-nose masks. People over 60 or with pre-existing conditions are to receive 15 FFP2 masks each from mid-December. The distribution will start in December in order to reduce the risk of infection during the Christmas season

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    Retail shops will close from 16 December 2020 until 10 January 2021, with the exception of  grocery stores, open-air food markets, direct marketers of food products, food collection and delivery services, beverage shops, health food shops, specialist baby shops, pharmacies, medical supply stores, drugstores, opticians, hearing aid shops, petrol stations, garages, bicycle workshops, banks and savings banks, post offices, dry cleaning services, launderettes, newsagents, pet supply shops, animal feed shops, the sale of Christmas trees and wholesalers. The sale in grocery stores of non-food products that are not related to daily needs can also be restricted and must on no account be extended. There will be a blanket ban on the sale of fireworks before New Year’s Eve this year.    Businesses offering personal care services such as hairdressers, beauty salons, masseurs, tattoo  parlours and similar establishments will be closed, because physical proximity is unavoidable in these professions. Necessary medical treatments, such as physiotherapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy, as well as podiatry and chiropody, will still be permitted.    Employers are urgently requested to explore the possibility of either closing workplaces  completely holidays or offering employees generous opportunities to work from home from  16 December 2020 to 10 January 2021 in order to implement the principle of “We are staying at  home” throughout Germany.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

Major events at which contact tracking and compliance with hygiene regulations is not possible should not take place until at least January 10, 2021. According to the new federal and state ruling of October 28, professional sport is only permitted without spectators.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

No changes for the last week. New changes are being proposed for the upcoming weeks    Links -   http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162625/https://www.deutschland.de/en/news/coronavirus-in-germany-informations  http://web.archive.org/web/20201214162943/https://de.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Details:  - Germany is imposing a hard lockdown from Wednesday.Trade, with the exception of shops for daily needs, will be closed from 16 December to 10 January  - For the days from 24 to 26 December, "meetings with 5 persons plus children up to 14 years of age in the closest family circle" are permitted.   - For New Year's Eve and New Year's Day (1 January), there is a nationwide ban on the presence and assembly of fireworks.  - German government wants to provide more than 27 million German citizens with mouth-nose masks. People over 60 or with pre-existing conditions are to receive 15 FFP2 masks each from mid-December. The distribution will start in December in order to reduce the risk of infection during the Christmas season

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    A nationwide ban on all gatherings will be in force on New Year’s Eve and New Year’s Day.  Fireworks will also be banned in highly frequented areas to be defined by the municipalities. There will be a blanket ban on the sale of fireworks before New Year’s Eve this year and a general recommendation not to let off any fireworks, also because of the high risk of injury and the fact that the health system is already under considerable pressure.    Church services and religious gatherings in synagogues and mosques are only possible under the  following conditions: the minimum distance of 1.5 metres must be maintained, the wearing of a face mask is mandatory even when seated, congregational singing is prohibited. For gatherings where the number of visitors expected could lead to capacity being exceeded, a registration requirement must be introduced. In addition, in the coming days talks will take place within and with the religious communities to determine appropriate regulations for religious gatherings in light of the developments in infection rates.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

According to the resolution of November 25th, a stricter contact restriction applies. Citizens are asked to reduce contact with other people outside of their own household to "an absolutely necessary minimum". The members of your own household and of another household may be in public together. The upper limit is 5 people from December 1st. Please also note the requirements in your region. In general, limit your private celebrations and stick to the AHA + L formula: keep your distance (1.5 meters), observe hygiene rules and wear everyday masks. Regular ventilation applies indoors. Also, note the rules in your state.

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    Private gatherings with friends, relatives and acquaintances will continue to be limited to a  maximum of 5 individuals from a total of two households. Children up to the age of 14 are not  included in this figure.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

The federal and state governments call for unnecessary travel to be avoided in general. This also includes unnecessary journeys in public transport. Please wear an everyday mask on the S-Bahn and trains, in the train station, on the platform and at the stops as well as on the airport premises and on the plane. The minimum distance of 1.5 meters to travelers and staff should always be observed. Deutsche Bahn provides many tips on safe travel on its website. Unnecessary queues, e.g. B. in front of the on-board toilet can be avoided. The respective national hygiene regulations apply when getting on and off and at the airports. In general, please adhere to the rules of conduct that are summarized in the AHA formula (distance, hygiene rules, everyday mask). In this way, everyone can make a contribution while traveling to contain the spread of the new type of coronavirus. This formula is supplemented by A for app (the Corona warning app helps to break chains of infection) and L for ventilation.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

Rail passengers who have to travel despite restrictions are to be offered a reliable means of traveling safely and with plenty of space. No specific restrictions, however, the government recommends avoiding using any form of transport and mobility if not urgently required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

People are expected to stay within small groups (see below), wear a mask and keep distance, but there are currently no restrictions to only leave the house for necessary reasons.  Staying in public is only permitted with the members of your own household and of another household and has been limited to a maximum of 5 people since December 1st. Citizens are also asked to refrain from private trips and visits. From December 1st, private get-togethers with friends, relatives and acquaintances are only permitted with members of your own household and those of another household, a maximum of five people may come together.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221252/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/en/inform/organising-everyday-life/

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    The Federal Government and the Länder urgently appeal to all citizens to avoid all non-essential  movement and recommend to stay at home.    Individual federal states also impose specific exit restrictions. For example, in the southern states in particular, leaving the home is only permitted if there are valid reasons for doing so (sports, shopping, doctor's appointments, etc.). The federal and state governments call for unnecessary trips and visits to be avoided.  According to the decision taken by the Federal and Länder Governments, from 2 November until at least 20 December hotels and other accommodation providers may only provide overnight accommodation to people whose travel is essential. It is no longer permitted to provide overnight accommodation for tourism purposes. Visas for tourism purposes will thus only be issued in exceptional cases. It is expected that these restrictions will be in place until at least early January 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    The Federal Government and the Länder urgently appeal to all citizens to avoid all non-essential  travel within and outside Germany between now and 10 January.    Individual federal states also impose specific exit restrictions. For example, in Mecklenburg Vorpommer, travel from other german states is currently not allowed (with exceptions).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218085957/https://www.regierung-mv.de/service/Corona-FAQs/Tourismus-und-Reisen/

Since November 8th, a mandatory quarantine of ten days has been in effect for all people entering from risk areas. The quarantine can be shortened if travelers can present a negative corona test no earlier than the fifth day after arrival.  There are no pandemic-related restrictions for entry from the other member states of the European Union as well as from the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Iceland. The current entry restrictions relate to entries from third countries.    However, the respective infection protection regulations of the federal states (including with regard to quarantine and reporting obligations) as well as the obligation to digitally register for entry must be observed by all people entering from risk areas.    Für Personen, die in anderen als den vorstehend genannten Drittstaaten ansässig sind, gelten die bisherigen Einreisebeschränkungen fort, d.h. sie dürfen nur nach Deutschland einreisen, wenn sie eine wichtige Funktion ausüben oder ihre Reise zwingend notwendig ist (siehe hierzu "Wann ist die zwingende Notwendigkeit der Einreise gegeben?"). Ansässig ist eine Person in einem Staat, wenn sie dort entweder ihren Wohnsitz oder ihren gewöhnlichen Aufenthalt hat. Ein Wohnsitz ist insbesondere dann begründet, wenn die letzten 6 Monate dort verbracht wurden.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/#faqitem=e2df90f7-8f7a-5c51-b42f-ecaffbcfe5f9  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221431/https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/faqs/DE/themen/bevoelkerungsschutz/coronavirus/coronavirus-faqs.html;jsessionid=36F79BE0E1058BB7E14840089EE197C4.1_cid373

New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    For Germany, travel restrictions apply for entry from a large number of countries. These are issued by the Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community (...)     In principle, entry is possible from:            - EU member states states associated with Schengen: Iceland, Norway, Switzerland and Liechtenstein the United Kingdom;  - Other countries, from which entry is possible due to the epidemiological situation assessment by the EU.  - Entry from other countries is only possible in exceptional cases and is conditional on there being an urgent Need."    Online entry registration is obligatory for travellers entering Germany from high-risk areas abroad, and that quarantine is mandatory for a period of 10 days following return. Quarantine can only be ended with a negative test, which can be taken on the 5th day after entry at the earliest.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129121721/https://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/en/coronavirus/2317268    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

The following simplified requirements for short-time work benefits come into effect retrospectively from March 1, 2020:  Short-time work allowance is possible for every company, including temporary workers.  If at least 10 percent of employees are affected by loss of work, your company can apply for short-time work for you at the Employment Agency. Otherwise at least a third of the employees must be affected.  The short-time work allowance is 60 percent of the missing net wage - 67 percent for parents with children.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221624/https://www.bmas.de/DE/Schwerpunkte/Informationen-Corona/Kurzarbeit/kurzarbeit.html;jsessionid=1DC14AC1B6727142FEF25C056E927711.delivery1-master

The measures mean that some sectors of the economy will still have to face significant  restrictions on their business operations in the coming year. The Federal Government will therefore  continue to provide financial support for the affected companies, self-employed individuals and selfemployed members of the independent professions. The improved interim financial help III package, which envisages subsidies for fixed costs, is available to this end. With improved conditions, in particular a higher monthly subsidy of up to a maximum of 500,000 euro for companies directly and indirectly affected by the closures, the Federal Government is doing what it can to safeguard businesses and employment.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1

In Germany the following groups of people are tested at the expense of the statutory health insurance:  People with symptoms typical of COVID-19.  For people without symptoms who have had close contact with a person infected with the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus.  People in communal facilities and accommodation (e.g. schools, daycare centers, refugee accommodation, emergency accommodation, penal institutions) if a person infected with the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus has been found in the facility.  Patients, residents and staff in the care facility or hospital when the facility has an outbreak of the virus. This also applies, for example, to facilities for people with disabilities, rehabilitation, outpatient operations or outpatient dialysis as well as to medical and dental practices and other practices for human medical professions, day clinics and the rescue service.  Patients or assistants before admission or re-admission: especially in medical facilities for inpatient and outpatient care (excluding practices of the human, dental or other medical professions), in (partially) inpatient facilities for the care and accommodation of elderly, disabled people and people in need of care outpatient care services and integration assistance services and in day clinics.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221933/https://www.bundesgesundheitsministerium.de/coronatest.html

The most important rule in all areas remains to maintain a minimum distance of 1.5 meters from other people and to minimize contact with other people. In addition, it is still advisable to observe the hygiene rules (correct coughing, sneezing and washing your hands) and to wear an everyday mask (mask requirement when shopping or in local public transport). Adequate ventilation should also be provided. So please stick to the AHA + L formula. The L stands for ventilation. It is recommended that the number of people with whom one has contact be reduced to "an absolutely necessary minimum".  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

Vaccine strategy in place with 3 phases of providing vaccine to the population (no dates confirmed):  Phase I: Limited quantity of vaccine available. The Danish Prime Minister imposed a partial lockdown in 38 municipalities from December 9 to January 3. School children from 5th grade upwards in the affected municipalities are to be sent home, with classes to take place online. The same restriction will be applied to all adult and further education, including upper secondary schools and universities. Exams will take place, but will be moved online wherever possible.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222064743/https://www.thelocal.dk/20201207/latest-denmark-announces-partial-covid-19-lockdown-until-2021

The Danish Prime Minister imposed a partial lockdown in 38 municipalities from December 9 to January 3. Restaurants, bars, cafes, gyms, sports centres and swimming pools are to be closed in the affected municipalities. Restaurants and cafes will be allowed to operate takeaway services. Public sector workers not in critical functions will work from home in the affected municipalities. Shops remain open.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222064743/https://www.thelocal.dk/20201207/latest-denmark-announces-partial-covid-19-lockdown-until-2021

The Danish Prime Minister imposed a partial lockdown in 38 municipalities from December 9 to January 3. Indoor areas at amusement parks, zoos, aquariums and similar types of attractions, as well as at museums, theatres, cinemas and libraries, will also all be closed to the public.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222064743/https://www.thelocal.dk/20201207/latest-denmark-announces-partial-covid-19-lockdown-until-2021

The current public assembly limit of 10 people imposed in October has been renewed and will stay in place over Christmas, while private events are still encouraged not to exceed 10 people, including during Christmas celebrations.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222064743/https://www.thelocal.dk/20201207/latest-denmark-announces-partial-covid-19-lockdown-until-2021

In a government announcement on the 9th of December, it was announced that all educational establishments across Estonia will be closed until 2021.   In person learning is allowed for students with special educational needs, personal consultations, olympiads, internships and examinations with measures of social distancing in place.   Kindergartens and childcare will remain open.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201209134400/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-imposes-additional-restrictions-both-ida-viru-county-and-across-estonia-prevent

From the 5th of December, there may be no more than 50% capacity of a given space in indoor sales areas and public spaces of stores and service areas. People must also adhere to the 2+2 rule.    From the 5th of December, catering and educational establishments and locations for holding public events where a stationary seat is not ensured to all attendees must close from 22:00 to 6:00. Takeaway food is permitted to operate during these hours.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201206171931/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-adopted-further-restrictions-prevent-spread-coronavirus

From the 12th of December, in Ida-Viru County, entertainment and accommodation facilities, museums and exhibitions must be closed to visitors. All sports facilities must be closed. This does not apply to professional sports activities. All sales and service halls of catering companies must be closed. Food takeaway and related courier service will be allowed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201210173303/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-approved-new-national-restrictions-and-restrictions-ida-viru-county

From the 12th of December in the Ida-Viru County, both outdoor and indoor public meetings and events, including conferences, theatre performances, concerts, and cinema screenings are not allowed.   Churches and other religious venues may continue to operate at 50% capacity with 2+2 distancing.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201210173303/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-approved-new-national-restrictions-and-restrictions-ida-viru-county

The 2+2 rules is extended to all public indoor spaces: two people can move together but must keep a distance of two metres from other people. 10+2 continues to apply in catering establishments and places where entertainment services are provided.   A lower maximum number for participants in public events will apply: up to 400 people at an indoor event with stationary seating, otherwise it is 250 people. For outdoor events, the maximum number is 500.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201124125119/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-approved-restrictions-prevent-spread-coronavirus

From the 14th of December, hobby education, hobby activities and sports activities for young people and adults will be suspended for three weeks. Only individual activities/learning/sports offered remotely or outdoors are allowed.   The restrictions do not apply to professional athletes.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201209134400/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-imposes-additional-restrictions-both-ida-viru-county-and-across-estonia-prevent

Masks must now be work in all public indoor spaces, including public transport and service points.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201124125119/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-approved-restrictions-prevent-spread-coronavirus

Higher education institutions should seriously consider switching to distance learning  https://web.archive.org/web/20201208010955/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions     Summary of which phase the regions are at can be found here:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201208011329/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases-and-vaccinations/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates/situation-update-on-coronavirus/the-covid-19-epidemic-regional-situation-recommendations-and-restrictions

In Helsinki, institutions of upper secondary education (upper secondary schools and vocational schools) will move to distance learning. The needs for necessary contact teaching will still be secured. Distance learning will begin at the start of the new evaluation period on 3 December 2020 and continue until 31 December 2020.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175327/https://www.hel.fi/helsinki/coronavirus-en/childhood-and    In the rest of the country, schools remain open but with social distancing measures in place.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175732/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/questions-and-answers

Employers must also promote work arrangements that reduce close contacts and other risk factors.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201208010955/https://valtioneuvosto.fi/en/information-on-coronavirus/current-restrictions

In accordance with the will of the President of the Republic, a new testing strategy is currently being deployed in order to "drastically reduce the delays" to better monitor the circulation of the virus on the territory, to be able to isolate and treat patients much more quickly. To achieve this, antigenic tests will be generalized in the short term, in addition to RT-PCRs, which remain the reference. More than 5 million tests have already been ordered and are made available to health establishments and ARS. These tests are CE marked and meet, according to the manufacturer's declarations, the minimum technical specifications provided by the High Authority for Health (sensitivity> 80%, specificity> 99%), which issued two opinions on the subject, the September 25 and October 9.https://covid-19.sante.gouv.fr/tests ).  Several screening campaigns have been initiated in universities, in particular for health students. This is for example the case in Ile-de-France with campaigns at the Faculty of Medicine of Sorbonne, Necker or even in a Nursing Training Institute in Paris. Other campaigns are being carried out in nursing homes to ensure screening of asymptomatic staff, particularly in the Occitanie, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes and Ile-de-France regions. These campaigns are in progress and an assessment could be drawn up later. The ministry wanted to broaden the experiments and deployment channels across the country very quickly.  In addition, liberal health professionals (pharmacists, nurses and doctors) are now authorized to carry out these rapid antigenic tests, ensuring a large-scale deployment and closer to the population.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19
No policy change
